intro: Sclerostachya, commonly known as the African grass or tall grass, is a genus of flowering plants in the grass family Poaceae. It is native to various regions of Africa and is characterized by its tall, robust growth habit. The plants typically have narrow, elongated leaves and produce spikelets that are often clustered at the ends of the stems. Sclerostachya species are adapted to a wide range of environmental conditions, including arid and semi-arid climates. These grasses are sometimes used in horticulture for their ornamental value and can also serve as forage for livestock in certain regions.
